title: Gorman 2013 The Pixie Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas are brooding, with notes of barrel spice, black licorice and jammy dark fruit. The cranberry and cherry flavors are palate coating and dense—a hedonistic delight.

title: Fabre Montmayou 2013 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Opaque to the eye, this is rich, heady and full of inky blackberry aromas and notes of graphite, balsam wood, tobacco and coconut. A lush, mile-deep palate offers chocolaty flavors of blackberry, roasted meat and salt. Ripe black-fruit flavors dominate a lush finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The Ned Late Harvest Waihopai River Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This version of Sauvignon Blanc retaqins its varietal character, yet in a sweet, unctuous expression. Passion fruit and grapefruit aromas and flavors are intense and concentrated into a tropical-citrus compote, ending in a long, tooth-achingly sweet finish.
designation: The Ned Late Harvest Waihopai River

title: Mesa Del Sol 2011 Late Harvest Zinfandel (Arroyo Seco)
description: Deep aromas of black-cherry syrup meet with raisin, leather and fudge on the rustic but inviting nose of this dessert bottling. It's sweet and lavish on the sip, but with impressive grip, showing strawberry and cherry-sauce flavors along with cinnamon and clove spice.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2014 Les Pierres  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: This wine is produced from a range of small parcels right through the appellation (including some Premier Crus) to give a full ripe wine that has great acidity as well as spice from the wood aging. It is a wine that shows elegance as well as concentration and a fine balance between fruit and acidity. Drink from 2018.

title: Spring Valley Vineyard 2013 Uriah Estate Grown Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Merlot (45%), Cabernet Franc (34%), Petit Verdot (8%), Malbec (8%) and Cabernet Sauvignon. Brooding aromas of green herbs, flowers and cherry lead to a ripe full-flavored palate that shows a fine sense of balance.

title: Testarossa 2014 Niclaire Pinot Noir (California)
description: Welcoming on the nose, this top-end bottling offers aromas of baked red cherry, clove and black plum before diving into crushed graphite, wet slate and loamy mud aromas. Soft on the palate but immediately vibrant with acidity, flavors of dark cranberry and tart cherry are lifted by anise-like spice.

title: Rideau 2014 Siempre Happy Canyon Vineyard Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A youthful expression of the grape, this bottling is clean and fresh on the nose with pressed olallieberries, candied blueberries, violet extract and a nicely smoky char component as well. There is exuberant energy on the sip, where that candied blueberry flavor is cut by savory miso-like flavors. Relatively light and lithe, this would pair with a wide variety of foods.

title: Tablas Creek 2014 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Dark berries, black plums and dried blueberries meet with crushed pepper and a touch of vanilla on the nose of this bottling. The palate is packed with blackberries galore, lifted by white pepper, beef char and other savory seasonings.

title: Santa Sofia 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of pipe tobacco, mature dark-skinned fruit, leather and cake spice meld together on this smooth structured red. The chewy, full-bodied palate delivers mature plum, black cherry marinated in spirits, mocha and cinnamon alongside velvety tannins. Drink 2017 through 2026.

title: Schramsberg 2012 Querencia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: From fruit grown in Carneros, 74% of it Chardonnay and 26% Pinot Noir, this includes grapes from both Hudson and Hyde vineyards. Gorgeously full bodied and elegant, it's dry on the palate with vibrant acidity to balance the tangy flavors of cherry, pomegranate and cranberry.

title: TintoNegro 2013 Finca La Escuela Estate Grown Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Jammy raspberry and plum aromas come with accents of dusty herbs and black licorice. A saturated, lush, jammy palate features soft, baked flavors of cassis and wild berry, while the finish delivers mint, chocolate and lasting berry ripeness. Drink through 2019.

title: Boheme 2013 Taylor Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a deliciously sultry, luxurious and yet lean, focused white, dark gold in color with tightly woven acidity. Textured and layered in pops of fennel, apple and pear, it was aged in both stainless and neutral French oak, allowing briny minerality and fruit-laden characteristics to shine.

title: Château Moncontour 2014 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)
description: This stylish wine is just at the right moment to drink. It comes from selected parcels in the vineyard and offers concentration as well as white and yellow fruits imbued with hazelnut and intense acidity. Drink now.

title: Col Solare 2013 Red (Red Mountain)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (88%) takes the lead on this wine, with the balance Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Syrah. Aromas of blackberry, blue fruit, flowers and barrel spice are followed by pitch-black-fruit flavors. Lightly chewy tannins provide some heft but have room to broaden.

title: DeMorgenzon 2015 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: This is a lush, creamy Chenin, brimming with rich notes of honeycomb, honeydew, ripe peach and orange cream. The palate is full and toasty, though ample acidity helps to keep the mouthfeel bright. Notes of baking spice and toasted nuts unfold on the back and linger long on the close. It's delicious now, but should hold and evolve well through 2021.

title: Castellani Michele & Figli 2012 Colle Cristi  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Plum cake, blue flower and baking spice aromas come together in the glass. The round chewy palate offers prune, raspberry jam, chewing tobacco, cinnamon and a sprinkling of cocoa alongside solid, velvety tannins. Drink now through 2022.

title: Castello di Amorosa 2014 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Big but balanced, this wine starts with very ripe fruit aromas, then brings bold black cherry, clove and blackberry flavors on a firm texture of fine-grained tannins and good acidity. The full body, layered fruit and dark spice elements make a great combination.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2013 Morrito Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Tart red-cherry aromas meet with purple flowers, cinnamon and a touch of rust on the nose of this bottling. Baked plum and underripe mulberry fruit play off each other on the palate, with a tart plum-skin element cutting through herbal touches of wild thyme, bay leaf and oregano.

title: Accordini Igino 2005 Le Viole Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Aromas suggesting mature dark-skinned berry, pipe tobacco, new leather and cedar slowly emerge on this concentrated red. The dense, round palate delivers raspberry jam, chocolate covered cherry, nutmeg and mocha framed in velvety tannins and surprising freshness. Drink through 2020.

title: Bailly-Lapierre 2009 Vive la Joie Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Produced from selected wines, this top of the range rosé is a textured, complex wine. It has ripe fruit reflected in the raspberry flavor and tight acidity. The texture shows minerality as well as intense fruitiness. Drink this fine wine from 2017.

title: Bel Vino 2008 Cabernet Franc (California)
description: Deep black cherry, black pepper and pine-wood aromas arise on this lavish bottling that retains a great deal of freshness despite being eight years old. The black-cherry richness extends to the palate, followed by pepper spice and woody cedar flavors, ending on cherry, strawberry and tobacco.

title: Bodegas Caro 2013 Amancaya Reserve Red Blend Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Rooty spicy aromas of earthy berry and leather give this Malbec-Cabernet blend a sense of quality from early on. A fully ripe but pure palate has some juice to it, while flavors of black currant, black plum, blackberry and chocolate aren't just heavy and oaky. True on the finish; drink through 2023.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: This Premier Cru vineyard is on a high point in the village. It has produced a rich fruity wine with great structure and dense tannins. Bold red fruits are dominant with the acidity in a supporting role. The wine is rich, full and needing to age. Drink this wine from 2018.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru

title: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2014 Le Grand Roc  (Sancerre)
description: Produced from 60-year-old vines, with some new wood aging, this complex, ripe wine has an intense structure, with layers of vanilla and spice. The crisp nature of Sauvignon Blanc adds brightness to the ripe roundness. Drink now.

title: Domaine Henri Delagrange 2014 Les Vaumuriens Hauts  (Pommard)
description: Vines grown on thin soil close to the stony subsoil produce this tight, taught and mineral wine. With acidity, structured tannins and concentration, the wine is still starting out. It is a dark wine with black fruits that need time to fully develop. Drink this intense wine from 2020.

title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Les Crais  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This wine comes from village appellation vineyards. It is soft and without the powerful tannins often found in the area. It compensates with dark berry fruits and some ripe tannins that are finely integrated into the wine. Acidity at the end adds to the potential of this wine which will be best from 2019.

title: Fazeli Cellars 2012 Hafez Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Baked blueberries, peppery allspice, wet gravel and a touch of vanilla show on this nose of this blend of 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 70% Shiraz, a spelling of Syrah used to reflect the owner's Persian heritage. Those elements are very well integrated on the palate, where a cedar-laced frame presents lots of dark red fruit and crushed spice.

title: Foxen 2014 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Reserved on the nose, this bottling by Billy Wathen and Dick Dore from their friend Rick Longoria's vineyard offers cranberry, fennel, lavender and a touch of smoke on the nose. It's delicate in its approach, with tightly woven strawberry, red plum and cranberry fruit lifted by dried sagebrush and more of that wildfire smoke.

title: Edmeades 2013 Gianoli Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Intense fruitiness along with touches of mint and baking spices make this full-bodied wine impressive as well as complex and layered. The vivid, ripe strawberry and blackberry components are well balanced by firm tannins and a light oak coating.
